discussion.content: if time constraints is of a concern as mentioned in the question, then differential is the answer since differential doesn't clear archive bit, full and incremental does which takes longer backup. Answer is differential

It is differential, both differential and incremental backs up data that has been change, but differential doesn't clear the archive bit, it would take incremental longer to restore since it clears the archive bit

An incremental backup is a backup type that only copies data that has been changed or created since the previous backup activity was conducted. An incremental backup approach is used when the amount of data that has to be protected is too voluminous to do a full backup of that data every day. @ specter003

Incorrect - differential grabs only new information 
https://www.acronis.com/en-us/articles/incremental-differential-backups/#:~:text=A%20differential%20backup%20backs%20up,since%20the%20last%20full%20back.&text=Incremental%20backups%20also%20back%20up,a%20full%20or%20incremental%20backup.

questions.question_text: An administrator needs to back up changed files only and has time constraints on the back up window. Which of the following is the BEST choice for a backup strategy?

A technician is having problems sending a notification from a server. The technician suspects the firewall may be blocking traffic. Which of the following clients can be used to confirm the technician's suspicions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I believe it's D. I do it at work when testing outlook365 connection to check if it's blocked by firewall or not: telnet smtp.office365.com 587

als, from chatgpt:

The correct answer is:

D. telnet
Explanation:
Telnet is a client used to connect to a specific port on a remote system. In this case, it can be used to test whether the firewall is blocking traffic on the relevant port (such as port 25 for SMTP, if the notification is being sent via email). By attempting to connect to the server on the specific port, the technician can determine whether the firewall is blocking the connection.

Here’s how telnet can be useful:

The technician can use telnet to connect to the server’s SMTP port (usually port 25, 587, or 465) and see if the server responds. If telnet cannot establish a connection, it may indicate that a firewall or other network configuration is blocking that specific port.

questions.question_text: A server has two power supplies. If power is lost to the second power supply, which of the following will occur?

choices.D: The UPS will exceed maximum load
choices.C: The automatic transfer switch will bring in generator power
choices.B: The server will remain in operation
choices.A: The server will gracefully shut down

discussion.content:
The question should read.
If one of the power supplies fail.......

Selected Answer: B
You should use TCP ports 389 and/or 636. Port 636 is for LDAPS, which is LDAP over SSL. Encryption on port 389 is also possible using the STARTTLS mechanism, but in that case you should explicitly verify that encryption is being done.
https://serverfault.com/questions/682594/which-ports-are-required-in-order-to-authenticate-against-a-ldap-server-in-anoth

questions.question_text: An administrator is setting up LDAP in the environment to allow directory services authentication and login, and wants to allow secure connection only. Which of the following network ports should be allowed on the internal and external firewalls?

choices.C: Twice as much heat will be generated in the server room
choices.B: Amperage consumed by each server will be reduced by 50%
choices.D: Power redundancy will be added to the server by providing two 110V power sources
choices.A: The room temperature will be reduced

questions.question_text: A company executive asks the network administrator to help to reduce power consumption in a datacenter. The administrator suggests changing the servers running on 110V to 220V. Which of the following will occur as a result of this action?

discussion.content: This question is written to throw you off, how this is written I assume there running more than indicated in the question so reducing the power consumption will reduce the temp.. So A is correct

Answer is B due to the following physical and technical reasons:

a) Voltage and Temperature have a linear relationship (via the resistance), therefore voltage increases as temperature increases;
b) This question can be summed up as the formula to compute the amperage, knowing Watts and Volts. The formula is: 1A = 1W / 1V

Hope it helps!

comments.content: however in this case they will have the same power consumption (same Watts)
